meanings.definition: The action of sealing joints or seams with a waterproof filler material.
meanings.sent1: The caulking around the bathtub prevented water from leaking onto the floor.
meanings.sent2: The handyman used caulking to seal the gaps in the window frames.
meanings.sent3: When the pirate ship sprung a leak, they resorted to caulking the holes with whatever they could find.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like caulking, sealing any cracks in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The caulking in the boat was so strong, not a drop of water could seep through.

meanings.definition: A waterproof filler material used to seal joints or seams.
meanings.sent1: The caulking applied to the roof kept the rain out of the house.
meanings.sent2: DIY enthusiasts often use caulking to fix minor leaks in pipes.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly claimed that the secret ingredient in his recipe was caulking.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as caulking, filling the gaps in their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The caulking in the dam was so effective, it held back the rushing water.
